docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Robert Ader, an experimental psychologist who was among the first scientists to show how mental processes influence the body's immune system, a finding that changed modern medicine, died on Tuesday in Pittsford, N.Y. He was 79. His death followed a long illness and complications of a fracture suffered in a fall, his daughter Deborah Ader said.

headline.main: Robert Ader, Who Showed Mind-Body Link, Dies at 79

docs.abstract: Dr Robert Ader, experimental psychologist who showed mind-body link, dies at age 79. Photo (M)
